description: Write 1,2,... in clockwise spiral, writing each digit in separate square; sequence gives numbers on positive x axis.
comments: Same as the South spoke of the Champernowne's spiral (A244677).
mathematica: almostNatural[n_, b_] := Block[{m = 0, d = n, i = 1, l, p}, While[m <= d, l = m; m = (b - 1) i*b^(i - 1) + l; i++]; i--; p = Mod[d - l, i]; q = Floor[(d - l)/i] + b^(i - 1); If[p != 0, IntegerDigits[q, b][[p]], Mod[q - 1, b]]];f[n_] := 4n^2 - 5n + 2; Array[ almostNatural[ f@#, 10] &, 105] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 08 2014 *)
